message.content:
9mrz | LIFE STORY INTERVIEW AND NARRATIVE ANALYSIS
pk06 | TODAY'S AGENDA
7wn9 | One. On stories and narratives
wcd0 | Two
caos | The narrative approach
qrvy | Three
pn9j | Steps to narrative analysis
1pmc | Four
5z6q | Let's practice! (small groups)
yeoh | IS THERE A DIFFERENCE?
b8hf | · Account
hntf | · Experience
99fo | · Story
y5r7 | · Narrative
lrry | NARRATIVE APPROACH
hvhm | Assumptions:
863b | One. People create meaning through narratives. Making sense of the world through narratives or stories.
fj24 | Two. Meaning is constructed in historical, social, cultural, and political contexts.
uz3c | Three. There is no "truth", only interpretations of "reality". Subjective construction.
d5bi | Four. Narratives shape one's self-concept and identity. The stories people tell about themselves reflect their beliefs, values, and personal history, contributing to the formation of a coherent sense of self.
ba4l | THEREFORE:
ffx8 | One. Content is important.
s6su | Words
y219 | Themes
06ht | Plot
v3r2 | Structure or Temporality
nv42 | Two.
xags | Dialogic or performative
jc47 | LIFE STORY INTERVIEW Considerations:
ko3c | · Structured - set of questions
xek3 | · Unstructured - one question or theme
bbpr | · Written stories - participant writing their own narratives
5zyf | · Conversational or dialogue - informal, no specific structure, researcher as part of the process.
9own | · Observations
bqfb | · Recording
wwdt | · Venue and Time
mn1r | · Ethical aspects
5vqw | NARRATIVE ANALYSIS
meyw | An approach taken to interview data that is concerned with understanding how and why people talk about their lives as a story or a series of stories. This inevitably includes issues of identity and the interaction between the narrator and audience or audiences.
2e62 | STEPS:
75y3 | FRAMING THE ANALYTICAL PROCESS
s2g2 | Clearly define the objective of your analysis. Decide what aspect of the narratives you want to explore and what insights you hope to gain.
q1q2 | COLLECT THE NARRATIVE or NARRATIVES
cb7r | Decide on how you would collect the narratives or stories.
68xu | FAMILIARIZATION
hd35 | Read or listen to the narratives multiple times to become familiar with the content and context. Take notes on key themes, emotions, patterns, and any initial impressions.
2zpk | CODING
epu7 | Identify and code meaningful units within the narratives. Codes are labels or categories that capture recurring themes, emotions, events, or elements of the stories. Read references, review related literature (make sure codes are justifiable!).
7od1 | STEPS:
0bqy | THEME DEVELOPMENT
b780 | Analyze the coded data within each category to identify overarching themes. These themes could represent recurring patterns, ideas, emotions, or experiences that are present in the narratives.
ccmb | NARRATIVE STRUCTURE ANALYSIS
ma93 | Pay attention to the structure of the narratives, including the way events are sequenced, the use of chronology, temporal shifts, and the inclusion of reflective elements. This can provide insights into how individuals construct their stories.
c6hh | CONTEXTUAL ANALYSIS
y7ea | Consider the cultural, social, historical, and personal contexts in which the narratives were created. These contexts can influence the way narratives are constructed and interpreted.
nav4 | INTERPRETATION AND MEANING-MAKING
gem8 | Reflect on the meanings conveyed in the narratives. Consider how individuals use storytelling to make sense of their experiences, emotions, and identities. Interpret the underlying messages and values present in the stories.
e8nr | STEPS:
k78w | GENERATING FINDINGS
g9du | Summarize your findings in a coherent and organized manner. Present the main themes, insights, and interpretations that emerged from the analysis.
f682 | REFLEXIVITY
li1k | Reflect on your own biases, assumptions, and perspectives that might have influenced the analysis. This reflexivity helps ensure the validity and credibility of your findings.
pbea | ETHICAL CONSIDERATIONS
ccpt | Throughout the analysis process, ensure ethical treatment of the narratives and the individuals who shared them. Protect confidentiality, respect privacy, and accurately represent the narratives.
0fpw | REPORT WRITING
dqn8 | Write a comprehensive report detailing your narrative analysis process, findings, and interpretations. Include relevant excerpts from the narratives to support your points.
cop0 | LET'S PRACTICE!
lhkq | QUESTIONS?
82ju | THANKS!
